original: Johannisson, Ture Gustaf, professor, Göteborg, f. 26/9/03 i Sundsvall av J. A. J. o. Juha Boman. G. 39 m. Lore Schmidt. Barn: Eva f. 40, Bengt 42, Karin 44. — Fil. kand. i Lund 26, fil. lic. 34, fil. dr 39. Vik. sv. lektor i Jena 29, sv. lektor i Marburg an der Lahn 30-38, jämväl i Giessen 36-38, doc. i nord. språk 39, prof. i nord. språk v. Gbgs högsk. sed. 45. Föresi. f. ortnamnsinst. v. Gbgs högsk. 45, led. av ndn f. sv. språkvård 45. Utg. ett 20-tal skr. i nord. o. germansk språkvet :skap, spec. rör. ordbildn. o. syntax, art. i Sv. akad. ordbok.
translated: Johannisson, Ture Gustaf, professor, Gothenburg, born on September 26, 1903 in Sundsvall, son of J. A. J. and Juha Boman. Married in 1939 to Lore Schmidt. Children: Eva, born in 1940, Bengt in 1942, Karin in 1944. - Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1926, Licentiate of Arts in 1934, Doctor of Philosophy in 1939. Temporary Swedish lecturer in Jena in 1929, Swedish lecturer in Marburg an der Lahn from 1930-1938, also in Giessen from 1936-1938. Docent in Nordic languages in 1939, professor in Nordic languages at Gothenburg University since 1945. Director of the Institute for Place Names at Gothenburg University since 1945, member of the committee for Swedish language preservation since 1945. Published around 20 writings in Nordic and Germanic linguistics, particularly focused on word formation and syntax, as well as articles in the Swedish Academy dictionary.
